array.string:
Antibiotics
  • Rapid administration of appropriate antibiotics

Antibiotics
  • Administer appropriate antibiotics within 6 hours.
    Source Control
  • Early imaging to confirm source if appropriate
  • Early surgical/interventional evaluation if appropriate
  • Early drainage of purulent collection or removal of infected device if relevant
Is the patient experiencing bleeding or ischemia?
( Vancomycin / amino-PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / metronidazole) *Consider broader C.Diff coverage with PO vancomycin
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / metronidazole ) *Consider broader C.Diff coverage with PO vancomycin
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / metronidazole / aminoglycoside ) *Consider treatment for fungals, Tb *Consider broader C.Diff coverage with PO vancomycin
( Vancomycin / ceftriaxone ) *Consider treatment for viral *Consider ampicillin for Listeria
( Vancomycin / cefepime ) *Consider treatment for viral *Consider ampicillin for Listeria
( Vancomycin / cefepime / acyclovir / ampicillin ) *Consider treatment for fungals, Tb
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vancomycin / macrolide / 3rd gen cephalosporin ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone ) *Consider treatment for influenza
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / Aminoglycoside ) *Consider treatment for influenza
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN / macrolide ) *Consider treatment for PCP, fungals, Tb *Consider treatment for influenza
( Vancomycin ) *Consider anti-pseudomonal PCN if diabetic or vascular disease *Consider clindamycin for suspected toxic shock syndrome
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) *Consider clindamycin for suspected toxic shock syndrome
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) *Consider clindamycin for suspected toxic shock syndrome
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vanco / carbapenem / fluoroquinolone )
( 3rd generation cephalosporin ) OR ( fluoroquinolone )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / Aminoglycoside ) *Consider treatment for fungals, Tb

Minimize Ventilator Induced Lung Injury
  • Low Pressure (Plateau/Total Pressures <25 - 30 cm H20)
  • 6-8 ml/kg/ IBW (see MORE)
  • Increase respiratory rate as needed up to 35 bpm to maintain ventilation
  • PEEP> =5
    Aspiration Precautions
  • Elevate Head of the Bed >30-45 degrees
  • Oral Care with Chlorhexidine
  • Gastric Acid Neutralization with IVH2 Blockers
Tidal
Is the patient's MAP < 60 or is there a need for vasopressors?

If Intubation is needed
    Aspiration precautions
  • Consider rapid sequence intubation by experienced clinicians
  • Administer IV H2 antagonist to neutralize gastric acid
    Minimize Ventilator Induced Lung Injury
  • Low Pressure (Plateau/Total Pressures <25 - 30 cm H20)
  • 6-8 ml/kg/ IBW (see MORE)
  • Increase respiratory rate as needed up to 35 bpm to maintain ventilation
  • PEEP> =5
Tidal
Is there a removable source?
What is the patient's respiratory status?
Non-Invasive Ventilation
Intubation/Mechanical Ventilation Required
Not Vented

Respiratory Support
  • Reassess work of breathing 30 minutes into non-invasive ventilation and consider early intubation for:
    • severe hypoxemia (P:F ratio <150)
    • lack of improvement in respiratory rate, use of accessory muscles, PaCO2 > 40 with pH >7.35
    If Intubation is needed
    Aspiration precautions
  • Consider rapid sequence intubation by experienced clinicians
  • Administer IV H2 antagonist to neutralize gastric acid
    Minimize Ventilator Induced Lung Injury
  • Low Pressure (Plateau/Total Pressures <25 - 30 cm H20)
  • 6-8 ml/kg/ IBW (see MORE)
  • Increase respiratory rate as needed up to 35 bpm to maintain ventilation
  • PEEP> =5
Tidal
Resuscitate with crystalloid or colloid and transfuse as needed to obtain euvolemia, consider CVP monitoring to prevent fluid overload (goal CVP 8-12)

• Resuscitate as needed, consider vasopressor to get MAP>60
  • Avoid fluid overload targeting CVP and urine output as per Fluid Management Goals in MORE
  • Avoid RBC transfusion unless Hgb < 7g/dL
Fluids
<font size="7">If mechanical ventilation is needed, consider Rapid Sequence Intubation IV H2 Blocker.</font>
Is the patient in shock?
<font size="7">Stop/Maintain Euvolumia (CVP 8-10)</font>

Adequate Communication
  • Contact the ICU or OR Resident/Fellow or Attending with structured SBAR Handoff:
      Situation
    • Introduce yourself and the patient
    • Briefly describe the patients situation and reason for ICU transfer or surgery
      Background
    • Briefly state the pertinent history
    • What got us to this point
      Assessment
    • Identify the patient as high risk for ALI/ARDS
    • Indicate CLIP elements to be implemented and continued
    • What is going on? Use your best judgement
    • What Intervention/treatment did you start and how did the patient respond?
    • What is the patient's current state
    • Is the patient improving, deteriorating, not changed?
      Recommendation/Request
    • Indicate CLIP elements to be implemented and continued for duration of ICU stay or during OR
    • What laboratory or radiologic tests are pending and will require follow up?
    • Who have been consulted and what recommendations have to be followed up on?
    • What therapies need to be continued or followed up on?
    • When did the patient last receive antibiotics?
<font size="7">The patient is already in the ICU. No action is necessary.</font>
Is the patient likely to go to the ICU?
Is surgery a possibility?
